summary: Veterans who have been arrested and jailed are at an increased risk of homelessness and mental health conditions. The VA created the Veterans Justice Outreach program, which served over 30,000 veterans in FY 2020, to address these issues. The program relies on about 400 specialists to act as a gateway to services. We found ways VA could better execute the program and improve access, including...
title: Veterans Justice Outreach Program: Further Actions to Identify and Address Barriers to Participation Would Promote Access to Services
